Replies.Reply: Bodies of the recently dead are returning to life and attacking the living. CLICK! With each CLICK, the TV disappears, then reappears in a new position ON SCREEN. CREDITS ROLL in the surrounding     BLACK.
Because of the obvious threat to    untold numbers of citizens, due to the crisis that is now developing this radio station will    remain on the air day and night.
o way. Some germ or some devil got them things up and walkin'. But there's a big difference between them and us. They're dead!
Pretty Boy's a dame?
No. I'm dead. You get bit by one f those things and you become what they are.

They're learning how to be us again. RILEY DENBO watches the town through binoculars. 32, made rugged by realities, he has a heart beneath his tough exterior. MIKE CONVERSE, 21, young and unseasoned, has the eagerness and passion of someone young and unseasoned.
good with those?
Great. I'm out here with a guy who can't shoot. Let's go.
Havin' a bad dream.
The town is full of walkers.
These aren't just walking. They're like...regular folks.
They dumped the trash. Cholo's on his way.
This one is. Last one was a guy.
Looks like nobody's hit it before.
Ain't about fun, Cholo.
Where you goin'?
Number Two, what's your location?
We're set.
Number Three?
Guns and ammo, Boss.
I'm not risking anybody's ass just so you can pick up some side money.
Harry. Beer?
Two people dead. That kid, Mike. He should be here with us right now.
Quittin' time, Deke.
Nope. When I said quittin' time, I meant quittin'    time.
Later. Gotta see a man about a car.
You can't fix a place like this, Mulligan. You just have to get out    of it.
Where's the car?
My new car. I paid for it. I was here yesterday. There were two guys getting it ready for me.
Sonofabitch!
Come on.
Lot of action tonight.
I went over to the garage. Your guys aren't there. The car's not there. My dinero's not there.
Just get me the car, or they'll carry you out of here inside that fucking hat.
Jesus fucking Christ.
In a little while. In the ring, BLACK reaches for SLACK again. With one lightning-fast move, she kicks it in the chest, sending it flying into Red's arms. Red shoves Black aside.
Somebody shot the little fat man.
Why you? In that arena.
Same question. Why you?
Places with people. I'm gonna find me a place where there ain't no people. North. Canada.
I don't need to hear your story.
Mulligan.
I don't drink.
Nobody else is sitting. I think I'll just stand here, like the rest of you. While you tell me why I'm standing here.
Why don't you just send out your troops?
Give me one of those vehicles, over    in the depot, weapons, and enough ammunition to go north.
That's the idea.
I have a way.
You guys don't have to come out with me if you don't want to.
Mister Denbo.
Cholo didn't do all this.
Stenches have been at this place.
That fencing was pushed in from outside.
There's a thousand of them out there for every one of us.
Gotta love the guy. He still believes in Heaven. Anyone got a radio? Teahouse pulls a Motorola from his belt. Just as he tosses it to Riley, they hear...GROWLING!
Riley Denbo. Calling the Green.
Ain't no keys to get. Melted.
I had a brother. Real brother, by birth. Bit. Hung on for six days.
That happened to my brother.
You said you were going to make yourself useful. Right now what I could use is for you to pull over.
I made a deal with your boss. Find Cholo. I'm gonna do it. Keep him from blowing up the Green. I'm gonna do it, I don't want people to get hurt.
Shit. He's going to Ross Park.
Cholo's moving out. Looks like he's heading right for us.
hit. Off this hillside...they can shell the Green. Pull in! There!
hey'll be coming up this road.
Grabbed the T-Bird.
Tracking you. With this.
the water.
Get back in there. What are you doing? BLAM! She shoots a WALKER that has come out of the night.

Shoot!
If no one has any objections.
That's life, brother. A whole lotta trash.
Let's go have some fun.
YEEEE-HAAAAAAAA!
kid. I'll show you the ropes. Mike climbs out and gets on the back of Cholo's motorcycle.
To get supplies. Essential supplies.

I'm still here, ain't I? Everyone relaxes. Cholo picks up the case of Dom. The others head toward the front of the store. TILT DOWN TO THE FLOOR as their feet move past. In the gloom behind stacks of cartons... ...A DEAD HAND appears. Reaching.

Shit! Look out, kid! The hand grabs Mike around the ankle! Mike turns, raising his gun. Too late. A DEAD UNIFORMED POLICEMAN, the skin on half its face STRIPPED DOWN TO BONE, RIPS A HOLE IN HIS LEG with its teeth! ike SCREAMS, staggers into a wall, and drops to a seated position on the floor. Riley and Charlie spin around at the    sound of his cry. Cholo, closest to Mike, pulls his crossbow and fires an arrow through the Zombie's head.
e take money to do nasty shit.
Everybody makes their own way.
y daddy...he picked fruit, penny-
No, I...
No problem, no problem! But there is a problem. There's a dead guy    walkin' around in here.
You wanna talk about this? I did what I had to do. I only did what I had to do!
Dead.
brought you back some presents.
ou probably want a glass, don't you? Sure, a high-toned man likes to drink out of a glass.
I got something else, too.
No, thank you! Twenty grand. That's what I got comin' for last night. I never bothered to pick it up.
Nope. I left it in the bank. Your bank. With all my other dough.
How long?
You mean restricted.
Don't do this to me. Don't do this to me.

No, no, no. Three years! Three years I been cleaning up after you, taking out your garbage, and you tell me I'm not good enough? You're the one who's no good. You are no fucking good. And you are gonna let me in. You know why? Because I know what goes on around here. How many of your fucking "members" know what's in that garbage I take out for you?
OU'LL LET ME IN OR I'LL...
We're taking the truck out. Get he guys.
No, not him. Just the regular uys. Know what I mean?
Nobody gets a day off these days.
Oh, I must have given you the wrong one. Here...
aufman?
You said we should talk when I was less excited. I'm a lot less excited now.
Put the money on a boat and send it across the river to the South Side.
Knock it off!
At midnight. Give me a call. Let e know if we're rich or not.
If I don't have this truck, I'm no different to Kaufman than that poor Mexican bastard out there.
He knows it's his ass if he doesn't.
Foxy. You're elected. Get out there and see what the fuck.       Foxy moves out through the open hatch.
Somebody go out and help.
How'd you get up here, Riley?
What are you doin' up here?
You weren't around to get invited. Anyway, I figured you wouldn't want in on this.
The hell you so happy about?
Who's the smart one now?
You did something, didn't you? With your FUCKING TOY!    Riley pushes another button on the "Game Boy". Outside...
Not this horse. You got the T-Bird?    I'll take that.
always wanted to see how the other half lives.
Need some help, Mister K.?
been bit, Mister K. I'm a dead man, so I don't care about nothin' no more. Still care about you, though. I wanna make sure you come to the same end as me.
hey're going to get you, Mister K.
ut it down, old man, unless you'd rather die right now.
You can go, Knipp, but not him.
I think we should talk when you're a little less excited.
They know we're here. They can smell life. Smell blood.
I love ya, Charlie. Know why?
We go in, do our job, and get out, all of us alive, okay? I don't want any fuck-ups on my last day out here.
Mike! Wait! But Mike has followed the others inside.
It's alright, son.
You're dreaming, Cholo. They'd never let me in. They'll never let you in. We're the wrong kind.
What happened to my fucking car?
You okay?
The truck.
One more thing. My friends. They go with me.
Got to, right?
How long since you been out here?
Pull over.
Charlie, keep these two covered.
You have a problem with that?
Bring her over as soon as you can!
We gotta blow the fences!
Number One is clear! I'm going for Number Two!
I'll try to make myself useful.
Jesus. You can't shoot, neither!
I thought it was gonna be a battle.
Tcha doin', Riley?
I have bad dreams. Hell, yes. Just look at me, you can tell that I have terrible dreams.
Every town is full of walkers.
But they're dumb, Riley. Hell, dead folks is near as dumb as me!
that, Riley? I don't get it. These here flowers ain't the kind you lay down on the ground. These here are sky flowers. Way up in Heaven.
Always ready. Just look at me ou can tell I'm always ready.
I don't think that's all you see.
What'd he do, hit the lottery or somethin'?
Wanna get a drink, Riley? Just ook at me, you can tell I could use a drink.
What happened, Riley. Didja get fucked?

He won't. Riley likes to be alone.
Hey...
I like the iron I already got.
Good thing we're smarter.
Catches the light. Right now it's moonlight.
That thing.
ff-center. But I got him.
Gotta go get the keys, Riley.
Not! That hurt! I didn't hurt you!

They all are. SKREEEEEEEE! ZOMBIE RATS crawl up onto the roadbed. DOZENS. Riley takes off away from them. Slack and Charlie hurry closer, firing, trying to pick the critters off. The rats reach Riley! Nip at his heels. He leaps. Swings onto a girder. Climbs to the control booth. The rats don't follow. Slack heaves a sigh of relief just before... ...SKREEEEEEEE! A second pack of rats scurries toward her! She vaults over a railing, dropping several feet to... ...the riverbank below. But there are rats here too! Charlie fires at them from above. BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! FUR AND BLOOD    FLY. But there are too many. He can't shoot them all.
O  kay, but you best get off the gun.
Got knocked off his bike in town.
outside the throat.

Ready?
My last day, too.
get some chuckles.

I didn't kill him. He got bit and he killed himself. Same thing I woulda done. And you!

I got it.
Come on, let's go.
AHHH...FUCK!
Let's grab the truck.
Harry, jump on!
A jug of good Kentucky goes for fifteen hundred back in town.
Riley?
Looks like no one's here. The gates stand wide open. There's no sign of life.
There could be stenches in there.
85                                                               85  THE T-BIRD rumbles along a road lined with large HOMES, once prized for their panoramic views. RILEY'S "Game Boy" BEEPS.
Me, too.
120                                                             120        EAD RECKONING drives upriver. THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: THE CITY can be seen BURNING in the distance.
I hate going under the fuckin' river.
Luxury living in the grand old style. Dine at one of three restaurants.
Isn't it time? Isn't it your time?
Stench! Ten o-clock!
Take its fuckin' face off.
Drop it! Cholo drops the poker and holds up his hands.
YOU STUPID OLD FUCK!
We've got the firepower, Riley. If you and your friends would come in with us, we'd be unstoppable. Mulligan holds out his bottle to Riley, who passes it to Charlie, who takes a swig.

We could still use you, Riley. Riley looks out at the city, where there is still scattered distant gunfire. He looks at Brian, standing at Mulligan's side, his innocent face speckled with the blood of the dead. Riley shakes his head.
We can't get out! There's no way out!

Daddy! Daddy's still locked up. Slack runs off with Brian, past a MANHOLE surrounded by canvas fences, "CAUTION" signs, and flaming OIL POTS. Phone call, sir.
neither. We're all on the same  S  side. Least we're supposed to be.

ord!

YOU SELFISH BASTARD! YOU LEFT ME   ALONE HERE!  She fumbles with the weapon, not knowing how to make it work.       The bitten security guard starts to lose all strength in his legs. The Dead Thing holds him up, as if waltzing with him, BITING HIM again and again. Cholo takes the gun from the woman and shoots the Hanged Man.
I need help. I need help!
You...FUCK!

Maybe I can find him for you. Come on in.       Riley is already in. He has pushed past the Tout and is striding into a fog where GAMBLERS are rushing to place bets with heavily-armed BOOKIES. We're reminded of a cock-fighting    joint in a Pancho Villa movie.
Gotta new kind of game.

I told you. Today it's something new. CLANG! Another gate opens in the cage. A hush falls as everyone awaits what will come. Including the Dead Men, who gaze with anticipation at the opening. What comes is...
Put me down! Put me down!
What? They're fixing it up.
Hey, this is not me. I did not do this to you. I am your friend. Put me down. Come on. I find out what went wrong.
My suit! You fucked up my new suit!
lack backs up, hits the wall of the cage and, terrified, starts to circle its iron perimeter. The Dead Men flank her. Black is the first to touch her. The crowd HOWLS.
lack continues to climb the cage, almost out of reach, but Black grabs one of her ankles, pulling her down and slamming her to the ground.
No guns in here! Riley gives him a rifle butt in the face and moves on.
I'm alright, I'M ALRIGHT!
ucker got my right arm. I'm a lefty.
It wasn't the little man. It was the big man. The man upstairs. He's got his fingers in everything down here.
They found out I was working with Mulligan and his people. Tired of eatin' off Cbones.
Wherever you're going, take me ith you.
I can shoot. And I can be pretty fucking useful. I had training. I was gonna join the Army. Up the Green. Till somebody figured I'd be a better hooker than a soldier.
What's your story, Riley?
Better'n you. The safety's off.
I'd feel like a dick if I didn't.
Some shit, ain't it? Goin' out to save a place we don't give a fuck    about.
Pillsbury speaks with a voice as deep as the Mindanao trench.
Look who's talkin'.
The hell you shooting at?
Even-Steven.
How long does he have?
And you said nothin' bad ever happened to you.
But you kept going.
up. Dead is dead. And that ain't you. And that ain't me.
Never been out. Lived in the city since...it was a regular city.
Huh?
This is what you were thinking about all along. You got me out here figuring I'm a boy scout, and now you're telling me we're just    stealing a fucking car?
No. I like the way you think.
We're running out of time here.
RILEY ducks under a caution gate at the entrance to the    bridge and starts across the roadway. Behind him...
There will be. Come with me.
No, we'll take you along with us.
The hell happened here?
Yeah, I see that. You're under arrest.
How was Uniontown?
You didn't?
Death intrudes on us even in the Green, I'm afraid. I heard about what happened with my neighbors.    I'm grateful for your help.
Thank you.

You mean here? In the Green? The Silhouetted Man steps away from the window. Expensively dressed, in his early 60s, he is PAUL KAUFMAN. He sets down the highball glass Cholo gave him, gets out a proper champagne flute, and fills it from the bottle, smiling politely at Cholo.
I'm sorry, Mister DeMora, but there's a very long waiting list.
This is an extremely desirable location. Space is limited.
Well, I do have a board of directors, a membership committee that has to approve...
Take my advice. Withdraw your funds from the bank and spend them somewhere else.
Maybe we should talk about this when you're less excited.
man any more.
Thank you, Knipp. I'll take it.
Yes?
Ah. The one that got away.
What do you want, Mister DeMora?
That's unfortunate.
We don't negotiate with terrorists.
Mister Denbo. Come in. Can I offer you a drink?
Well, then...please sit down.
Which has guns. Big guns. That could do a great deal of damage if he were to aim them at this city.
But...there's nothing up north.
Alright. You've named your price.
Take them.
an you find Dead Reckoning?
anolete.
Teahouse.
illsbury.
Alternate sites have been chosen.
Cliff, let me talk to you for a moment.
You interrupted me. I was just talking about how people can be replaced. You don't want to be replaced, do you?

No, and I don't want to replace you. You have promise. A day may come when you earn yourself some responsibilities. Right now, the responsibilities are mine. All the responsibilities. It was my    ingenuity that took an old world and made it into something new. I put up fences to make it safe. I hired soldiers and paid for their training. I keep the people on the streets away from us by giving them their games and vices. It costs me money! But I spend it because the responsibility is mine! Now do you    understand "responsibility"?
No buts.
Take him out with the rest of the garbage. I won't be needing this man anymore.
No. Pack us up. We might have to be leaving.
Yes?
They can't get in. Downstairs. The car. The Dead Things POUND at the doors. One Guard runs away. The Other Three follow.
et back here! GET BACK HERE!
Pull out! PULL OUT!
THE CHOLO THING reaches for Kaufman, vengeance in its eyes.
I'm sorry, but...

We need you to repossess a vehicle that belongs to us. The vehicle you designed, Mister Denbo. Dead Reckoning has been stolen. By your second in command. I want him captured. Or killed. And I want my two-million-dollar piece of equipment returned.

I recognize that some of you are concerned. We've been threatened by a disgruntled employee. I've sent people out to take care of the problem. However, should something go wrong, I want to assure you that measures have been taken. I've established outposts. With food and supplies to support us on our way.
All the others can be replaced.
You fucking spic bastard!
Shoot it! Shoot the damn thing!
What can you do? Every place is the same.
I don't norm'ly need fourteen rounds.
Me too. Just look at me you can tell I'd feel like a dick.
Geez. Cholo made a mess.
I like the way he thinks, too.
RILEY!
Everything changed for all of us.
Thanks, Charlie. That was useful.
orry, man. I truly am.
You win. You got him in the brain.

Quit scratching around back there.
Sure.
I'm just standin' here. I'm not doin' nothing.
here's nothing there. Nothing but BRANCHES being slapped by erratic gusts of wind.
hey race into the street level of the three-story ATRIUM.

That's how I am called...Manolete.
